title: Should the Philippines sever its diplomatic ties with the United States and cancel the Mutual Defense Treaty? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, I don’t think so. I reckon that this question was asked in the wake of those US senators demanding us that we release de Lima from prison, which we won’t. This is merely an issue of sovereignty which isn’t respected by interventionists in Congress, whether Democrat or Republican. Duterte is, in fact, friends with Trump because the latter respects our sovereignty, especially when he supported our war on drugs. Which is why, despite my issues with him, I don’t want Trump to lose the elections next year. Either him or at least Gabbard as POTUS. Because all we want is for America to treat us as equals and not stick her nose into any of our internal affairs.

That would be up to the Filipino people themselves to decide… but, speaking as an American citizen…I don’t think that would be very wise for them to do so… as without the treaty they become vulnerable to Chinese economic and political pressure… which is not in their long term interests. I have met several people from the Philippines… they seem very nice people… and personally I would prefer that our two nations strengthen their relationship… rather than end it… as the Filipinos have more in common with Americans than they do with the Chinese… despite both Chinese and Filipinos being Asian… culturally the Philippines are far more a western country than is China… so a mutual alliance between the U.S. and the Philippines makes more sense… especially as we have no claims to their adjacent waters… unlike China.
